intro: Humboltia chloroleuca, commonly known as the whiteleaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers and broad, waxy leaves that are typically light green to white in color. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Humboltia chloroleuca thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
